paragraphs.text: “Really? Come on man, just have one.”
paragraphs.name: 15db

paragraphs.text: 2. Alcohol
I didn’t vote.
paragraphs.name: d9e5

paragraphs.text: Start looking at what life has already given you. Not what you don’t have. For it is only when you make this change of mind that your cup will start overflowing with abundance.
paragraphs.name: 024d

paragraphs.text: I’m not positive if you become the average of the five people you spend the most time with, but I am confident that if your lifestyle does not add to your healing, it will subtract from it.
paragraphs.name: 549c

99682648532d.title: Yep. Television was not made for you to be happier. It’s made to control your attention!

paragraphs.text: Yep. Television was not made for you to be happier. It’s made to control your attention!
paragraphs.name: d0ec

paragraphs.text: Learning this truth.
paragraphs.name: d63d

3bfcce38ae19.title: Validation is so hard. We need it but if we rely on it, it will destroy us.

paragraphs.text: Validation is so hard. We need it but if we rely on it, it will destroy us.
Thanks, Ryan. I agree it can be so difficult to break free from the norm. But it makes it that much more important.
paragraphs.name: c531

8718d9fdd75a.title: This reminds of a quote I read in a magazine that featured ​Paul Arden Ave he said, “Stop looking…

paragraphs.text: This reminds of a quote I read in a magazine that featured ​Paul Arden Ave he said, “Stop looking for the next best opportunity, the one you have in hand is the best one.”
paragraphs.name: 3df1

paragraphs.text: What a great quote!
paragraphs.name: 34c5

2ffbc9c86459.title: Thanks for posting this, but you left out one important item in my opinion and that is Religion.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for posting this, but you left out one important item in my opinion and that is Religion. Anxiety and depression ruled my life for a long time. I credit the freedom and peace I have now to dropping two things, alcohol and religion. Neither of those things presented an easy transition nor will the items you listed. But from my experience the journey to freedom is very much worth the effort.
paragraphs.name: 52ba

paragraphs.text: Thank you for writing this. I am actively working on some of these same things to deal with my anxiety. Its always nice to know other people have gone through the same thing and came to some of the same decisions. Giving up these things has gotten me to a point where I feel the best I have ever felt in my life. Thanks for sharing your success and strategies with others.
paragraphs.name: fe44

129a81592311.title: So…you run away from your friends and move cross country…and then reintroduce them back?

paragraphs.text: So…you run away from your friends and move cross country…and then reintroduce them back? Like they’ll take you back when you left them because they were standing in your way of success??? Any good therapist will tell you you need a great support system around you when dealing with anxiety. It’s one thing to abandon unhealthy relationships but I don’t think he mentioned that.
paragraphs.name: d14b

40e170476a9f.title: I didn’t leave my support system, I left behind the people that were living a life contrary to my…

paragraphs.text: I didn’t leave my support system, I left behind the people that were living a life contrary to my growth. And if they are true friends (not bottom feeders) they will ultimately respect you more, which will lead to a deeper relationship. Or at least that’s how it worked for me. Tribes are necessary for mental health, but if you are part of tribe that does not align with your core values, you are destined to fail.
paragraphs.name: 50c7

paragraphs.text: Great article. I was surprised how much this mirrored my own journey. I stopped owning a TV 30 years ago (although I did buy one 15 years ago….then gave it away). Many people can’t believe that I read 50–90 books most years. Although I’ve always enjoyed reading the newspaper, I gave that up when I realized that it caused anxiety and fueled anger…
paragraphs.name: 05fc

d4b17aa6a3ce.title: I am just so happy that you have! I still have a lot to figure out, I’m sure!

paragraphs.text: I am just so happy that you have! I still have a lot to figure out, I’m sure!

807216abcb64.title: Michael, thanks for your insight! So valuable

paragraphs.text: Michael, thanks for your insight! So valuable
paragraphs.name: 388a

paragraphs.text: Rachel, soooo amazing! It’s funny how sometimes small (not easy) change can really change our life! So happy for you and your continued health!
paragraphs.name: cce0

b476acdd00b5.title: Most of my anxiety as an adult was generated from my drinking.

paragraphs.text: Most of my anxiety as an adult was generated from my drinking. I am 99% anxiety-free now that I’m sober. While I was drinking, I wasn’t convinced that the alcohol alone could cause that much change in me. Escalators, bridges, balconies, airplanes, confined spaces, being the center of attention - all became torture for me. After 30 days sober, I…
paragraphs.name: f884

50fdcdafa7b3.title: Leann — Thanks for your kind words.

paragraphs.text: Leann — Thanks for your kind words. Just know this, you are not alone. And you are worth it. Love yourself and be gentle. Take it one day at a time. 1% every day is better than -1%. Remember that.
paragraphs.name: e385

d1d92407bc3b.title: From Jan 20, that Trump became the president my anxiety sky rocketed.

paragraphs.text: From Jan 20, that Trump became the president my anxiety sky rocketed. On Jan 27 he signed the first EO that affected me. Then another.
paragraphs.name: 1c0f

paragraphs.text: I am not a citizen, I could not vote, but those who could did not. So, now I’ve got depression, and I’m not sure if I can visit my family for the next 4 years.
paragraphs.name: 43b1

paragraphs.text: But sure, voting is too much work for you guys.
paragraphs.name: 99a8

content.subtitle: I am not a citizen, I could not vote, but those who could did not. So, now I’ve got depression, and I’m not sure if I can visit my family…

virtuals.subtitle: I am not a citizen, I could not vote, but those who could did not. So, now I’ve got depression, and I’m not sure if I can visit my family…

paragraphs.text: Love this list. Well thought out and very applicable. I think that the most important thing for me was realizing that social validation, though it matters, cannot matter too much. Not when you realize what the world does as a matter of fact.
paragraphs.name: 62d0

98a5ae49dff2.title: I tried my very best to not highlight every word.

paragraphs.text: I tried my very best to not highlight every word. It’s as if you know exactly who I am, what I struggle with and desire from my life, then wrote out a plan. I’ve already started this journey and have already gotten so much criticism from others who are convinced I can’t live my own life. Thank you so much for sharing this. I think I’ll reread it now.
paragraphs.name: 71f7

paragraphs.text: Great read! Too many times I have found myself falling in line with the herd. Pushing myself outside of these norms and listening to MYSELF has brought me so much peace and satisfaction. Keep at it!
paragraphs.name: ad72

99ef614ee96.title: The day I quit watching news my productivity reached the skies.

paragraphs.text: The day I quit watching news my productivity reached the skies. It is a fabulous formula to get rid of worries. Rest of the tips are also awesome.
paragraphs.name: 4a2f

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing
paragraphs.name: 5c6f
